Key Arguments: Debate is essential for democracy, and the legislation would suppress free speech.
Governments should not be the arbiters of truth, as they have previously spread misinformation.
The bill could lead to censorship of factual information and reasonable arguments.
The legislation could infringe on freedom of opinion and expression as per the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The bill gives excessive power to ACMA to determine intent and suppress dissenting voices.
Notable Quotes: No government or government-appointed body should be the arbiter of truth.
Silencing dissenting opinions, squashing public debate, and preventing access to the marketplace of ideas is what dictatorial governments do.
It is impossible for anyone else to truly know what an individual’s purpose or intention is, and this amendment is frightening in its ability to impose intent onto a person’s actions.
Censoring debate and punishing dissent has and will result in harm – to the health and wellbeing of all Australians, and to our democracy.
